analyzed: yā pana tā ujukā su jātā tā sammā parihareyya
translated: He would cut down the weeds and clear the grove well.🔽He would tend the straight trees and not tend the crooked ones.

original: Evañhetaṁ, bhikkhave, sālavanaṁ aparena samayena vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjeyya.🔽Evameva kho, bhikkhave, tumhepi akusalaṁ pajahatha, kusalesu dhammesu āyogaṁ karotha.
analyzed: evam ha ita bhikkhave sālavanam aparena samayena vuddhim virūḷhim vepullam āpajjeyya  evam eva kho bhikkhave tumhe api akusalam pajahatha kusalesu dhammesu āyogam karotha
translated: In the same way, monks, this Sālavana will eventually grow, increase, and mature.🔽In the same way, monks, you should abandon the unwholesome and practice the wholesome.

original: Evañhi tumhepi imasmiṁ dhammavinaye vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjissatha.
analyzed: evam hi tumhe api imasmin dhamma vinaye vuddhim virūḷhim vepullam āpajjissatha
translated: In this way you will grow, increase, and mature in this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, imissāyeva sāvatthiyā vedehikā nāma gahapatānī ahosi.
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhikkhave imissāya eva sāvatthiyā vedehikā nāma gahapatānī ahosi
translated: Once upon a time, monks, in this same Sāvatthī there was a housewife named Vedehikā.

original: Vedehikāya, bhikkhave, gahapatāniyā evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: vedehikāya bhikkhave gahapatāniyā evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: And a good report about the housewife Vedehikā had spread thus:

original: ‘soratā vedehikā gahapatānī, nivātā vedehikā gahapatānī, upasantā vedehikā gahapatānī’ti.
analyzed: soratā vedehikā gahapatānī nivātā vedehikā gahapatānī upasantā vedehikā gahapatānī iti
translated: ‘The housewife Vedehikā is gentle, the housewife Vedehikā is mild, the housewife Vedehikā is peaceful.’

original: Vedehikāya kho pana, bhikkhave, gahapatāniyā kāḷī nāma dāsī ahosi dakkhā analasā susaṁvihitakammantā.
analyzed: vedehikāya kho pana bhikkhave gahapatāniyā kāḷī nāma dāsī ahosi dakkhā analasā su sa vihita kammantā
translated: Now the housewife Vedehikā had a slave named Kāḷī who was clever, diligent, and quick in her work.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷiyā dāsiyā etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave kāḷiyā dāsiyā etat ahosi
translated: Then Kāḷī thought:

original: ‘mayhaṁ kho ayyāya evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: mayham kho ayyāya evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: ‘A good report about my mistress has spread thus:

original: “soratā vedehikā gahapatānī, nivātā vedehikā gahapatānī, upasantā vedehikā gahapatānī”ti.🔽Kiṁ nu kho me ayyā santaṁyeva nu kho ajjhattaṁ kopaṁ na pātukaroti udāhu asantaṁ
analyzed: soratā vedehikā gahapatānī nivātā vedehikā gahapatānī upasantā vedehikā gahapatānī iti  kim nu khalu me ayyā santayā iva nu khalu ajjhattam kopam na pātukaroti udāhu asanta
translated: ‘The housewife from Videha is patient, the housewife from Videha is peaceful, the housewife from Videha is calm.’🔽‘Do they not see my anger, or do they not see it?

original: udāhu mayhamevete kammantā susaṁvihitā yena me ayyā santaṁyeva ajjhattaṁ kopaṁ na pātukaroti, no asantaṁ?
analyzed: udāhu mayham eva ete kammantā su sa vihitā yena me ayyā santayā iva ajjhattam kopam na pātukaroti no a santa
translated: Or is it that I have not done my job properly, so that they do not see my anger?

original: Yannūnāhaṁ ayyaṁ vīmaṁseyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham ayyam
translated: I’d better test them.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷī dāsī divā uṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave kāḷī dāsī divā uṭṭhāsi
translated: Then the slave girl got up during the day.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikā gahapatānī kāḷiṁ dāsiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vedehikā gahapatānī kāḷim dāsim etat avoca
translated: The housewife from Videha said to her,

original: ‘he je kāḷī’ti.
analyzed: he je kāḷī iti
translated: ‘Hey, Kāḷī!’

original: ‘Kiṁ, ayye’ti?
analyzed: kim ayyā iti
translated: ‘Yes, Lady?’

original: ‘Kiṁ, je, divā uṭṭhāsī’ti?
analyzed: ki je divā uṭṭhāsi iti
translated: ‘Why did you get up during the day?’

original: ‘Na khvayye, kiñcī’ti.
analyzed: na khvayye kiñci iti
translated: ‘I didn’t, Lady.’

original: ‘No vata re kiñci, pāpi dāsi, divā uṭṭhāsī’ti kupitā anattamanā bhākuṭiṁ akāsi.
analyzed: no vata re kiñci pāpi dāsi divā uṭṭhāsi iti kupitā anatta manāḥ bhākuṭim akāsi
translated: ‘You didn’t? You bad slave, you got up during the day!’ And she made her angry and unhappy by scolding her.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷiyā dāsiyā etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave kāḷiyā dāsiyā etat ahosi
translated: Then the slave girl thought,

original: ‘santaṁyeva kho me ayyā ajjhattaṁ kopaṁ na pātukaroti, no asantaṁ;
analyzed: santayā iva khalu me ayyā ajjhattam kopam na pātukaroti no asanta
translated: ‘The housewife does not see my anger,

original: mayhamevete kammantā susaṁvihitā, yena me ayyā santaṁyeva ajjhattaṁ kopaṁ na pātukaroti, no asantaṁ.
analyzed: mayham eva ete kammantā su sa vihitā yena me ayyā santayā iva ajjhattam kopam na pātukaroti no a santa
translated: ‘My work is well organised, so that my master doesn’t get angry with me.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ bhiyyoso mattāya ayyaṁ vīmaṁseyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham bhiyyosaḥ mattāya ayyam
translated: Why don’t I test him even more?’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷī dāsī divātaraṁyeva uṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave kāḷī dāsī divātarayā iva uṭṭhāsi
translated: So Kali got up even earlier the next day.

original: ‘Na khvayye, kiñcī’ti.
analyzed: na khvayye kiñci iti
translated: ‘I didn’t do anything, madam.’

original: ‘No vata re kiñci, pāpi dāsi, divātaraṁ uṭṭhāsī’ti kupitā anattamanā anattamanavācaṁ nicchāresi.
analyzed: no vata re kiñci pāpi dāsi divātaram uṭṭhāsi iti kupitā anatta manāḥ anatta mana vācam nicchāresi

analyzed: no vata re kiñci pāpi dāsi divā uṭṭhāsi iti kupitā anatta manāḥ aggaḷa sūcim gahetvā sīse pahāram adāsi sīsam vobhindi
translated: ‘You didn’t do anything? You bad slave, you got up early!’ Angry and displeased, she grabbed a key and hit her on the head, splitting it open.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷī dāsī bhinnena sīsena lohitena galantena paṭivissakānaṁ ujjhāpesi:

translated: ‘Look at the work of Sorata,

analyzed: passathayye nivātāya kamma passathayye upasantāya kamma
translated: look at the work of Nivata, look at the work of Upasanta.

original: Kathañhi nāma ekadāsikāya divā uṭṭhāsīti kupitā anattamanā aggaḷasūciṁ gahetvā sīse pahāraṁ dassati, sīsaṁ vobhindissatī’ti.

translated: How could she, angry and displeased, hit me on the head with a key and split it open just because I got up early?’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vedehikāya gahapatāniyā aparena samayena evaṁ pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vedehikāya gahapatāniyāḥ aparena samayena evam pāpakaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchi
translated: Then, after some time, a bad report about the female householder Vedehikā spread:

original: ‘caṇḍī vedehikā gahapatānī, anivātā vedehikā gahapatānī, anupasantā vedehikā gahapatānī’ti.
analyzed: caṇḍī vedehikā gahapatānī anivātā vedehikā gahapatānī anupasantā vedehikā gahapatānī iti
translated: ‘The female householder Vedehikā is violent, the female householder Vedehikā is unyielding, the female householder Vedehikā is unpeaceful.’

original: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, idhekacco bhikkhu tāvadeva soratasorato hoti nivātanivāto hoti upasantūpasanto hoti yāva na amanāpā vacanapathā phusanti.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhikkhave idha ekaccaḥ bhikkhu tāvat eva sorata sorataḥ hoti nivāta nivātaḥ hoti upasantu upasantaḥ hoti yāva na amanāpā vacana pathā phusanti
translated: In the same way, monks, a monk is as gentle, as yielding, as peaceful as long as unpleasant speech does not touch him.

original: Yato ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṁ amanāpā vacanapathā phusanti, atha bhikkhu ‘sorato’ti veditabbo, ‘nivāto’ti veditabbo, ‘upasanto’ti veditabbo.
analyzed: yatas ca bhikkhave bhikkhum amanāpāḥ vacana pathāḥ phusanti atha bhikkhu sorataḥ iti veditabbaḥ nivātaḥ iti veditabbaḥ upasantaḥ iti veditabbaḥ
translated: But when unpleasant speech touches a monk, then he should be known as ‘gentle’ and ‘yielding’ and ‘peaceful.’

original: Nāhaṁ taṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṁ ‘suvaco’ti vadāmi yo cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu suvaco hoti, sovacassataṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: na aham bhikkhave bhikkhum suvacaḥ iti vadāmi yaḥ cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra hetu suvacaḥ hoti sovacassatam āpajjati
translated: I do not call a monk ‘easy to speak to’ if he is easy to speak to for the sake of robes, almsfood, resting place, and medicinal requisites.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ alabhamāno na suvaco hoti, na sovacassataṁ āpajjati.🔽Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṁyeva sakkaronto, dhammaṁ garuṁ karonto, dhammaṁ
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāram a labhamānaḥ na suvacaḥ hoti na sovacassatam āpajjati  yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave bhikkhu dhammayā iva sakkarontaḥ dhammam garum karontaḥ
translated: When he doesn’t get the robe, almsfood, dwelling, and medicinal requisites he needs, he’s not easy to live with and doesn’t practice to make himself easy to live with.🔽But when a monk respects, reveres, and venerates the Teaching,

original: mānento, dhammaṁ pūjento, dhammaṁ apacāyamāno suvaco hoti, sovacassataṁ āpajjati,
analyzed: mānentaḥ dhammam pūjentaḥ dhammam apacāyamāno su vacaḥ hoti sovacassatam āpajjati
translated: and practices to make himself easy to live with,

original: tamahaṁ ‘suvaco’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: tam aham su vacaḥ iti vadāmi
translated: I say that he’s easy to live with.

original: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘dhammaṁyeva sakkarontā, dhammaṁ garuṁ karontā, dhammaṁ mānentā, dhammaṁ pūjentā, dhammaṁ apacāyamānā suvacā bhavissāma, sovacassataṁ āpajjissāmā’ti.
analyzed: tasmā ati ha bhikkhave dhammayā iva sakkarontāḥ dhammam garum karontāḥ dhammam mānentāḥ dhammam pūjentāḥ dhammam apacāyamānāḥ su vacāḥ bhavissāma sovacassatam āpajjissāma ati
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train like this: ‘We will respect, revere, and venerate the Teaching, and practice to make ourselves easy to live with.’

original: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam hi vaḥ bhikkhave sikkhitabba
translated: That’s how you should train.

original: Pañcime, bhikkhave, vacanapathā yehi vo pare vadamānā vadeyyuṁ—🔽kālena vā akālena vā;🔽bhūtena vā abhūtena vā;
analyzed: pañcime bhikkhave vacana pathāḥ yehi vaḥ pare vadamānāḥ vadeyyu  kālena vā akālena vā  bhūtena vā abhūtena vā
translated: There are these five ways of replying to questions.🔽You may be asked a question that you should reply to after investigating the matter.

original: saṇhena vā pharusena vā;
analyzed: saṇhena vā pharusena vā
translated: Or you may be asked a question that you should reply to after giving a reason.🔽Or you may be asked a question that you should reply to after asking for it to be repeated.

original: atthasaṁhitena vā anatthasaṁhitena vā;
analyzed: attha sahitena vā anattha sahitena vā
translated: whether it is for their benefit or harm,

original: mettacittā vā dosantarā vā.
analyzed: metta cittā vā dosantarā vā
translated: whether they are motivated by good will or ill will.

original: Kālena vā, bhikkhave, pare vadamānā vadeyyuṁ akālena vā;
analyzed: kālena vā bhikkhave pare vadamānāḥ vadeyyuṃ akālena vā
translated: Whether they speak at the right time or the wrong time,

original: bhūtena vā, bhikkhave, pare vadamānā vadeyyuṁ abhūtena vā;🔽saṇhena vā, bhikkhave, pare vadamānā vadeyyuṁ pharusena vā;🔽atthasaṁhitena vā, bhikkhave, pare vadamānā vadeyyuṁ anatthasaṁhitena vā;
analyzed: bhūtena vā bhikkhave pare vadamānāḥ vadeyyuṃ abhūtena vā  saṇhena vā bhikkhave pare vadamānāḥ vadeyyum pharusena vā  attha sahitena vā bhikkhave pare vadamānāḥ vadeyyuṃ anattha sahitena vā
translated: whether what they say is true or not,🔽whether what they say is gentle or harsh,🔽whether what they say is beneficial or harmful,

original: mettacittā vā, bhikkhave, pare vadamānā vadeyyuṁ dosantarā vā.
analyzed: metta cittāḥ vā bhikkhave pare vadamānāḥ vadeyyum dosantarāḥ vā
translated: whether they are motivated by good will or ill will.

original: Tatrāpi vo, bhikkhave, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:
analyzed: tatra api vaḥ bhikkhave evam sikkhitabba
translated: And you should train like this:

original: ‘na ceva no cittaṁ vipariṇataṁ bhavissati, na ca pāpikaṁ vācaṁ nicchāressāma, hitānukampī ca viharissāma mettacittā, na dosantarā.
analyzed: na ca iva no cittam vipariṇatam bhavissati na ca pāpikam vācam nicchāressāma hita anukampī ca viharissāma metta cittāḥ na dosantarā
translated: ‘Our minds will remain unaffected, and we will not utter evil words. We will abide with our minds full of good will and a friendly attitude, without any inner hate.

original: Tañca puggalaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā pharitvā viharissāma, tadārammaṇañca sabbāvantaṁ
analyzed: tam ca puggalam mettā sahagatena cetasā pharitvā viharissāma tad ārammaṇam ca
translated: And we will abide pervading that person with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, and beginning with that person, we will abide pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.’

original: lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cittena vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena
analyzed: lokam mettā sahagatena cittena vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena
translated: with a mind filled with loving-kindness, vast, exalted, measureless, free from enmity, free from ill-will,

original: pharitvā viharissāmā’ti.
analyzed: pharitvā viharissāma ati
translated: and we will abide pervading the entire world with a mind filled with loving-kindness, vast, exalted, and measureless.’

original: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam hi vaḥ bhikkhave sikkhitabba
translated: This is how you should train yourselves.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso āgaccheyya kudālapiṭakaṁ ādāya.
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave purisaḥ āgaccheyya kudāla piṭakam ādāya
translated: Suppose a man came with a shovel and basket

original: So evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: saḥ u evam vadeyya
translated: and said:

original: ‘ahaṁ imaṁ mahāpathaviṁ apathaviṁ karissāmī’ti.
analyzed: aham imam mahā pathavim apathavim karissāmi iti
translated: ‘I will turn this great earth into water.’

original: So tatra tatra vikhaṇeyya, tatra tatra vikireyya, tatra tatra oṭṭhubheyya, tatra tatra omutteyya:
analyzed: saḥ tatra tatra vikhaṇeyya tatra tatra vikireyya tatra tatra oṭṭhubheyya tatra tatra omutteyya
translated: He would dig here and there, scatter the soil here and there, spit here and there, and urinate here and there,🔽saying:

original: ‘apathavī bhavasi, apathavī bhavasī’ti.
analyzed: apathavī bhavasi apathavī bhavasi iti
translated: ‘Be water, be water!’

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññatha, bhikkhave,
analyzed: tam kim maññatha bhikkhave
translated: What do you think, monks?

original: api nu so puriso imaṁ mahāpathaviṁ apathaviṁ kareyyā”ti?
analyzed: api nu saḥ purisaḥ imam mahā pathavim a pathavim kareyya ati
translated: Would that man turn the great earth into water?”

original: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: “No, venerable sir.”

original: “Taṁ kissa hetu”?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: “And why not?”

original: “Ayañhi, bhante, mahāpathavī gambhīrā appameyyā.
analyzed: ayan hi bhante mahā pathavī gambhīrā appameyyā
translated: “Because this great earth is deep and immeasurable.

original: Sā na sukarā apathavī kātuṁ;
analyzed: sā na sukarā apathavī kātu
translated: It is not easy to turn it into water.

original: yāvadeva ca pana so puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā”ti.
analyzed: yāvat eva ca pana saḥ puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assa ati
translated: That man would only get tired and frustrated.”

original: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, pañcime vacanapathā yehi vo pare vadamānā vadeyyuṁ—
analyzed: evam eva kho bhikkhave pañcime vacana pathāḥ yehi vaḥ pare vadamānāḥ vadeyyu
translated: “So too, bhikkhus, there are these five courses of speech…

original: kālena vā akālena vā;
analyzed: kālena vā akālena vā
translated: whether timely or untimely,

original: bhūtena vā abhūtena vā;
analyzed: bhūtena vā abhūtena vā
